reviewText: This movie is so cute, and my daughter just loved it!Paula and Zoe actually teach you a bunch of different dances and then they put it all together. It is slow enough where you could work with your son and daughter on the dances. Plus it gets you up and moving! Zoe and Paula are very good in this movie.

reviewText: Great for 3 year old!  My grand daughter is a born dancer.  She love this and danced all over the house!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Zoe's Dance Moves is a great deal of fun!  Paula Abdul leads Zoe, Elmo and a class of enthusiastic youngsters in learning dance styles from all over the world in a colorful and highly entertaining program!  We picked this DVD up after watching a preview of it and it is one of my little one's favorites!!  He is only 17 months old but loves watching Paula teaching Zoe all these incredible dance moves!!  He hops up and down on the sofa and points his fingers and yells..Elmo! Zoe!! and squeals with glee!  Although the video is designed for preschoolers..little ones under 2 seem to enjoy it as well!Paula's infectious enthusiasm and energy make the program very entertaining!  She should make more videos of this nature!!  There is also a nice interview with Paula about her dance influences and early years studying dance!  Very educational!A great DVD and a great value!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is adorable. Paula Abdul, though I am not a fan, is even cute in this video. The dance moves are easy. They, being Paula and Zoe, take it very slow and even an 18 month old could learn and follow (after watching the video a few times). Anyway, the mix of children, muppets, music, dances and Paula are perfect and worth the money. Buy it!

reviewText: This is a mixed bag; Paula Abdul is a lovely dancer, and is good at talking to the puppet rather than sneaking looks at the puppeteer (a common problem with celebrities talking with muppets.)She is, however, no expert on child development, and choreographed moves way out of the preschooler range of motor skills. Heck, no dance teacher worthy of the name would give steps that complicated even to adults with no dance experience! (She is listed on the credits as one of the choreographers, not just a performer.)As other reviewers have noted, the hip roll/grind is not something you want your 3 year old to master. The producers tried to get around its inappropriateness by calling it Zoe's Hip roll, and having Paula grunt, "This is for YOU, Zoe!" when demonstrating it. Really icky. (I do have to wonder if any of the advisors noted that perps of child abuse commonly tell the kids that what they are doing is their special little secret.)Kids with enough motor skills to really get the dance steps don't want to watch Zoe anymore, so I don't much worry that my little girl will "get" it. And it will get the younger kids moving, even though they won't master the steps.  Additionally, the clips of dances from other cultures are quite good, although grouping all "Asian" and "African" dances together seems a bit odd.  Why not call it by a more specific cultural name?  Or call ballet "European" just to be fair?It's fun, it gets the kids moving, but it's not the way I would have wanted it done.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Although this video is about 10 years old it is still classic.  Paula Abdul can really dance and can really relate to our 3 year old.  A child that young CAN learn many dance moves,  ballet, jazz and pop,  and release a lot of extra energy in the process!!  GREAT to put into the DVD player when a little one needs productive activity.  I believe we have found that our little one will be able to successfully and happily move on to real dance lessons.

reviewText: I could have done without Paula in this but my daughter enjoyed the dancing...she was trying to dance also...more like jumping!!!  She enjoyed it!!!  Neat to see the dances in other cultures.We like Zoe, I feel she enjoyed this one.
